title.native: もっと To LOVEる -とらぶる-

description:
Did Riko Yuuki’s life go to hell in a handbasket when a naked alien princess from the planet Deviluke suddenly appeared in his bathtub and he found himself betrothed into the universe’s most dysfunctional romantic relationship? No, but only because he never got a damned handbasket. Even if the luscious Princess Lala is finally starting to admit her real feelings for her earthling scum significant other, there are so many other things constantly going wrong that Riko’s doing well just to survive.

Whether it’s due to bounty hunters, a defective transporter, body switches, alien skunks, mighty morphing power bathrooms, a sleepover that goes horribly, horribly wrong, or, that worst galactic scourge of all, Valentine’s Day, each day seems determined to prove why you should never, ever, marry a monster from outer space!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

node.description:
__Height:__ 165 cm

[Website](https://www.tomatsuharuka.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/tomatsuharuka-blog)

Tomatsu debuted in 2007, starring in Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica as Corticarte Apa Lagranges. Since then, she has had other major roles such as Lala Satalin Deviluke in To Love-Ru and Shiho Sannomiya in Zettai Karen Children. Before graduating from high school in 2008, she used to live in Ichimomiya city where she often took the shinkansen, traveling back and forth between Nagoya and Tokyo to attend recordings. On January 11, 2019, she married a man from outside the entertainment industry.

One of the members of the voice actress unit [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Mary - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yabuki_info)

A Japanese manga artist. His mentor was Takeshi Obata, the illustrator of Death Note, Hikaru no Go, Bakuman and Platinum End. The mangaka [Shinohara Kenta](https://anilist.co/staff/97994/Shinohara-Kenta) is his brother-in-law.

Yabuki is best known for his series Black Cat, which ran from 2000 to 2004 in Weekly Shounen Jump and later adapted into an anime. Upon its ending, Yabuki expressed desire to make a sequel from the series, or make its characters reappear in another work. From 2004 to 2020, he only worked as illustrator to works written by other authors, most notably on To Love-Ru alongside his former assistant Saki Hasemi. That was until the release of Ayakashi Triangle on the pages of Shounen Jump in 2020.

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Saki Hasemi is a Japanese anime scripter and manga writer, best known for authoring the manga series To Love Ru and To Love Ru Darkness alongside illustrator Kentaro Yabuki.
Kouhei Kawase is a Japanese producer, composer and radio personality.

Akio Takami is an animator, animation supervisor and character designer. Originally a member of Ashi Productions, he joined Xebec in the 90s, where he participated in most of Xebec's works and became one of the key people at the studio.

Akio Takami is an animator, animation supervisor and character designer. Originally a member of Ashi Productions, he joined Xebec in the 90s, where he participated in most of Xebec's works and became one of the key people at the studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/299563377) | [Website](https://skeb.jp/@oka_yu_1)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/), where he's currently focused in training young animators.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/299563377) | [Website](https://skeb.jp/@oka_yu_1)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/), where he's currently focused in training young animators.
**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.
